function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inequality in access to housing and its impact on health outcomes creates a social gradient that may contribute to differential exposure to contagious diseases.","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Transmission of social harms leading to health inequalities within the built environment","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Amplification of pre-existing health inequalities within the home environment","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Psycho-social impact of home instability and housing uncertainties on health and well-being","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious diseases in overcrowded housing conditions due to inadequate housing","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Social harm from lack of wholesome food and exposure to various forms of danger","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Structural context of social problems contributing to preventable harm","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of access to affordable heating and suitable housing","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Structural housing harms such as homelessness, financialization, predatory lending, rogue landlordism, housing displacement, evictions, deregulation, loss of life and homes in disasters","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of the term ’social murder’ and structural ’violence turn’ in housing studies","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Exposure to damp, mould, cold, polluted, over-crowded, noisy dwellings","category":"Housing Conditions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Coercive control, physical, psychological or sexual violence by an intimate partner or family member","category":"Family","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to health hazards in the built environment during covid-19 lockdowns","category":"Health Hazards","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risk of social gradient in harm within different welfare regimes","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unequal impacts of covid-19 pandemic","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to covid-19 in the built environment","category":"Contagious Diseases","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mental distress and harm from home-based impacts","category":"Mental Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Public health emergency due to withdrawal or inability to access support services for victims of dv and ipv during lockdowns.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased incidence of ipv during lockdowns, with economic stress and confinement at home being correlated with different types of violence.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rise in spousal violence during lockdown","category":"Public Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increase in ipv during lockdown","category":"Public Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"180% increase in ipv at a radiology clinic during lockdown","category":"Public Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Systemic gender-based violence and femicide","category":"Public Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of criminalization of ipv in some countries","category":"Legal","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increases in rates of domestic violence and intimate partner violence dv and ipv during stay-at-home lockdowns.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Wide variations in the status of psychological violence and coercive control in countries where domestic violence is criminalized.","category":"Legal","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Substantial mental health harms attributable to covid-19 lockdowns, including years of life lost yll due to psychosocial consequences.","category":"Mental Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased rates of common mental disorders cmd and psychological distress during lockdown.","category":"Mental Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Pronounced social gradient in the mental health consequences of lockdowns.","category":"Mental Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increase in generalised anxiety disorders and depressive symptoms during lockdowns.","category":"Mental Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increase in suicidal thoughts during lockdown","category":"Mental Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative mental health effects of lockdown","category":"Mental Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social inequality, housing inequalities, and health inequalities","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Prolonged exposure to harmful homes as a mechanism for health inequalities","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased health harming behaviors during lockdown, including smoking, alcohol consumption, and poor diet.","category":"Health Behaviors","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Declining levels of physical activity and reductions in fruit and vegetable intake during lockdown.","category":"Health Behaviors","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased binge drinking during lockdown.","category":"Health Behaviors","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased alcohol consumption during lockdown","category":"Health Behaviors","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inequality in housing and health","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Narratives against mask-wearing and vaccination during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Public Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Home as a place where social harms are stored and amplified during lockdowns","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of focus on social inequality, health, and housing.","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unexplored concepts such as social murder, ontological security, and home un-making.","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of recognition of social harm perspective as a building block for housing studies.","category":"Social Inequality","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The research involving data collection may involve direct contact with individuals, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Quality assurance team assessing deliverables can lead to gatherings and meetings, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Industrialist inputs collected through questionnaires may involve physical handling of documents, increasing the risk of disease
